d685030c-3eea-4c3e-80df-679f0195db8f.description: The earner of this badge completed the 2-Year Cyber Academic Pathway which includes courses Cybersecurity I & Cybersecurity II. Earner has prepared for careers in Cybersecurity and Information and Communications Technology (ICT).

b9ec35b5-1092-4b2f-9af4-16a45097c76b.description: The earner of this badge completed the Computer Information Systems (CIS) Dual-Enrollment college course through Moreno Valley College through the Moreno Valley Unified School District Cyber Academic Pathway. Earners have knowledge of basic concepts of systems; business and web services software; networks; data storage and management; information and systems security; and the development of information systems.

ff03d4c2-74d9-49a8-bba0-cbec7e6b3f20.description: The earner of this badge completed one full-year Computer Operating System Security (COSS). Computer Operating System Security Fundamentals has an emphasis on making Windows and Linux operating systems more secure from cyber attacks via virtual imaging software. Earners also learn the basics of networking, mobile, and web-based application security.
ff03d4c2-74d9-49a8-bba0-cbec7e6b3f20.name: Computer Operating System Security

badge_template_activities.title: Enrolled in Computer Operating System Security (COSS)
Completion of course with grade "C" or better.
10 hours of Community Outreach and service in Cyber hygiene.

Passing of Comprehensive Exam: Covers all of the cybersecurity topics covered in the course, including security details and concepts of each topic will be covered for Windows, Linux, mobile, networking and web-based applications, which  include the purposes, the implementations, and the applications of computer operating system security.

Completion of Summative Project : build a Windows and a Linux virtual image with at least two built-in vulnerabilities for each of the seven elements of computer operating system security. The project will include a written description of each vulnerability, how the vulnerability jeopardizes the security of the computer and how the vulnerability can be fixed.
10 hours of job shadowing and attendance of 3 or more industry presentations via webinar or in-person.

7affe296-1246-4f7b-85ba-7f3f5becf9c3.description: The earner of this badge completed one full-year AP Computer Science Principles. AP Computer Science Principles course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of computer science and challenges them to explore how computing and technology can impact the world. The AP Program designed AP Computer Science Principles with the goal of creating leaders in computer science fields.
7affe296-1246-4f7b-85ba-7f3f5becf9c3.name: AP Computer Science Principles

issuer.summary: issued by Moreno Valley Unified School District

alignments.name: College Board AP Computer Science Principles Conceptual Framework

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of course with grade "C" or better.

Passing with a minimum of 12 hrs of class time and completion and submission of a complete program code, a video that displays the running of the program and demonstrates functionality developed, and individual written responses to all prompts in the performance task.
Creative Development-incorporating multiple perspectives through collaboration improve computing innovations as they are developed. Skills 1.C., 1.A., 4.A., 3.A., 1.B., 4.C., 6.A., 6.C

Data-The way a computer represents data internally is different from the way the data are interpreted and displayed for the user. Programs are used to translate data into a representation more easily understood by people. Skills 3.C., 1.D., 2.B., 5.B., 5.D.
Algorithms and Programming-To find specific solutions to generalizable problems, programmers represent and organize data in multiple ways. Skills 3.A., 4.B., 3.B., 3.C., 2.A., 2.B., 1.D., 1.A.
Computing Systems and Networks -Computer systems and networks facilitate the transfer of data. Skills 5.A., 1.D.
Impact of Computing-While computing innovations are typically designed to achieve a specific purpose, they may have unintended consequences. Skills 5.C., 5.E., 1.C., 5.D.
